wikipedia_page.main: Robert Errington Rowell (born 29 August 1939) is a former English rugby union player; a lock forward.  He was capped twice by England; both times against Wales, the first on 18 January 1964 in the 1964 Five Nations Championship (a 6–6 draw at Twickenham Stadium), and again a year later on 16 January 1965 (a 14–3 loss at the National Stadium, Cardiff Arms Park). He made 355 appearances for the Leicester first XV between 1962 and 1978; only Martin Johnson has played more times for Leicester at lock.  He was Leicester captain for the 1976–1977 season.
